comment.author: 9161595@N03
comment._content: Is this an early play on the "get your goat" phrase? The saying supposedly originally had something to do with horse racing, but there's debate about whether or not this is true. In any case, the phrase was in American use by 1904, so a Yale reference to it by 1910-1915 seems plausible.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content:

Yale Has Harvard's Goat. Freshmen Paint Its Horns Blue and Shear "Y" on Its Side

Source: New York Times; June 4, 1914
